Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed, a person involved in the conversations said.
According to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: After vetting four candidates for one position, the remaining directors couldn’t agree on who should fill it, said the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Hours after Mr. Altman was ousted, OpenAI executives confronted the remaining board members during a video call, according to three people who were on the call.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: three people who were on the call

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: On Sunday, Mr. Sutskever was urged at OpenAI’s office to reverse course by Mr. Brockman’s wife, Anna, according to two people familiar with the exchange.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: two people familiar with the exchange

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft...
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: employees who would be directly affected by the leadership change

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Document Sources.Source Justification: primary source; direct communication from the involved party

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: A version of this article appears in print on Nov. 22, 2023, Section A, Page 1 of the New York edition with the headline: OpenAI Faced Bitter Divide Before Firing.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I did not feel we’re on the same page on the damage of all this,” he wrote in the email. “Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: directly involved party; CEO of OpenAI at the time

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: official representative; providing context on the departure of co-founders

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Jason Kwon, OpenAI’s chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board’s mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that “benefits all of humanity,”
